name: EOD Primary Tumor
title: EOD Primary Tumor
footnotes:
(1) Fritz AG, Ries LAG (eds). **SEER Extent of Disease 1988: Codes and Coding Instructions (3rd Edition, 1998)**, National Cancer Institute, NIH Pub. No. 98-2313, Bethesda, MD, 1998

(2) Young JL Jr, Roffers SD, Ries LAG, Fritz AG, Hurlbut AA (eds.). **SEER Summary Staging Manual-2000: Codes and Coding Instructions**, National Cancer Institute, NIH Pub. No. 01-4969, Bethesda, MD, 2001.

(3) Collaborative Stage Work Group of the American Joint Committee on Cancer. **Collaborative Stage Data Collection System User Documentation and Coding Instructions, version 02.05**. American Joint Committee on Cancer (Chicago, IL)

(4) Gress, D.M., Edge, S.B., Gershenwald, J.E., et al. **Principles of Cancer Staging**. In: Amin, M.B., Edge, S.B., Greene, F.L., et al. (Eds.) AJCC Cancer Staging Manual. 8th Ed. New York: Springer; 2017

(5) Woltering, E.A., Bergsland, E.K., et al. **Neuroendocrine Tumors of the Jejunum and Ileum**. In: Amin, M.B., Edge, S.B., Greene, F.L., et al. (Eds.) AJCC Cancer Staging Manual. 8th Ed. New York: Springer; 2017

(6) **Neuroendocrine Tumors of the Jejunum and Ileum**, from the AJCC Cancer Staging System Version 9 (2023). Used with permission of the American College of Surgeons, Chicago, Illinois.
rows:
Tumor less than or equal to 1 cm AND confined to
- Intramucosal, NOS
- Lamina propria (including in a polyp)
- Mucosa, NOS
- Muscularis mucosae (including in a polyp)
- Submucosa (superficial invasion) (including in a polyp)

Localized, NOS

Tumor greater than 1 cm

OR Invades muscularis propria 
Invasion of muscularis, NOS

Invasion through muscularis propria
Extension through wall, NOS
Subserosal tissue/(sub)serosal fat invaded
Transmural, NOS 
Wall, NOS

Adjacent (connective) tissue(s), NOS (without serosal penetration)
Fat, NOS
Mesenteric fat
Mesentery (adjacent loops of bowel)
Nonperitonealized perimuscular tissue
Retroperitoneum

Invasion of/through serosa (mesothelium) (tunica serosa) (visceral peritoneum)

Abdominal wall
Colon (including appendix)
Other segments of the small intestine via serosa
Retroperitoneum invaded greater than 2 cm in depth

Bladder
Fallopian tube(s)
Ovary(ies)
Uterus

Further contiguous extension

Unknown; extension not stated
Primary tumor cannot be assessed
Not documented in medical record

Death Certificate Only
